thread.title: Pick 6 Preview | 6 things to watch: Seattle Seahawks at Cincinnati Bengals (Week 5)
thread.title_full: Pick 6 Preview | 6 things to watch: Seattle Seahawks at Cincinnati Bengals (Week 5) - seattlepi.com

author: STEPHEN COHEN, SEATTLEPI.COM STAFF
title: Pick 6 Preview | 6 things to watch: Seattle Seahawks at Cincinnati Bengals (Week 5)
text:
The Seattle Seahawks will look to move over the .500 mark for the first time in the 2015 season when they travel to Cincinnati to take on the Bengals on Sunday, but it won't be easy.
The 4-0 Bengals have been one of the most impressive teams through the first quarter of the NFL season, with quarterback Andy Dalton leading a high-powered offense that features a stout line, a receiving corps headed by all-star A.J. Green, and the potent two-headed running back attack of Jeremy Hill and Giovani Bernard.
The Cincinnati defense features a tough line, anchored by defensive tackle Geno Atkins, as well as quality players throughout all three levels. It's a unit that's yet to give up a rushing touchdown on the season, which isn't exactly good news for a Seahawks running attack that's yet to score in 2015.
Head coach Pete Carroll knows the Seahawks will have to play their best to emerge with a win on Sunday.
"There's a lot of concerns when you play this football team," he said on Friday. "This is a very well-balanced football team. This is a team that does everything well. There's no weakness. They're high-flying and healthy and all that. So this is a game that calls for us to play very well in all aspects."
Kickoff is scheduled for 10 a.m. Pacific on Q/13 TV and ESPN 710 Seattle radio. Check out seattlepi.com starting about an hour before kickoff for our live coverage.
Here are our six things to watch when the Seahawks take on the Bengals in The Queen City.
Visit seattlepi.com for more Seattle Seahawks news . Contact sports reporter Stephen Cohen at stephencohen@seattlepi.com or @scohenPI .
